cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 miles south of Camagüey, Cuba
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-north-west over Cuba today, then turning northwest across the central Gulf of Mexico toward the Texas–Louisiana border mid-week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Texas-Louisiana border, west-central Louisiana coast

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire U.S. Gulf Coast from Texas to Alabama, with greatest risk along the Louisiana coastline
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (40–60 mph) possible late Wednesday into Thursday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential inundation of 3–7 ft above normally dry ground along the lower Mississippi Delta including Plaquemines Parish
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–8 inches of rain possible, producing flash flooding in low-lying areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rainbands Wednesday night and Thursday
